entry.title: Re: MANAGE REPAYMENT REQUEST APP NOT FOUND
entry.content:
Hello @FabioSpulveda 

The Manage Repayment Requests app (F5754) appears in the Fiori Apps Library for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, but it is part of FI-CA Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable.

FI-CA is not part of the standard Finance scope; it is only available if scope item 5D2 ‚Äì Convergent Invoicing and FI-CA  , or a related industry package, is activated. If that scope is not included in your subscription, the app will not appear.

Review scope items in Manage Your Solution, and if needed, request activation through the CBC /SAP contact.

SAP Help ‚Äì Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA) Overview

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to send Data (Integration) from SAP Datasphere to...
entry.content:
Hello Ahmed,

You cannot connect SAP Datasphere directly to GRDC. GRDC only receives data from S/4HANA Cloud through communication scenario SAP_COM_0241 or via file uploads.

In Datasphere, to enable GRDC to access the data, you must first load it into S/4HANA Cloud, using methods such as the Journal Entry ‚Äì Post API or the Group Reporting APIs. Afterwards, GRDC retrieves the data from S/4.

Alternatively, export your data from Datasphere as a CSV file and upload it into GRDC using a data collection task.

The Application Server field in Datasphere should point to your S/4HANA Cloud API URL (e.g., https://<tenant>.s4hana.cloud.sap). The disabled features in your connection setup are expected, because Datasphere ‚Üí S/4 connection is designed for reading and writing via OData, not for GRDC integration.

To verify integration, review the Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0241 in S/4 for status and logs, and execute a test package in GRDC to confirm data fetch.

Please inform me if you require any further assistance.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Please tell me about the types of graphs in SAC.
entry.content:
Hi @tsuuuu 

In SAC, there are different charts like :

bar charts to display rectangular bars,

bubble or scatterplot charts to display circles,

but there is no built-in chart type that directly combines bars, circles, and rectangles in one chart by default.

Not sure if custom widgets can help here. Need to try it out.

BR, Prabhith

entry.title: Re: MANAGE REPAYMENT REQUEST APP NOT FOUND
entry.content:
Dear @FabioSpulveda , 

please check the following steps: 

 

  • Check the Manage Your Solution app: In your Fiori launchpad, go to the Manage Your Solution app. Search for the scope item: Look for the Accounts Payable scope item (J60) in the list of activated business processes. If this scope item is not active, submit a request to SAP to activate it. 
  • The Manage Repayment Request app is a specialized tool. To access it, you need to be assigned a business role that includes the relevant business catalog. I had already a look and made for you a screenshot below with the business catalog.
  • Even with the correct scope item and role, the app may not appear due to other system settings. If you have the correct role but still can't find the app, it might be due to a custom business role that doesn't include the necessary catalog or a misconfigured launchpad

 

Thank you and BR

Dilan

entry.title: How to contact SAP-Copilot / SAP-Copilot-cn orgs to enable features in Github Copilot?
entry.content:
[Background context] I am a new hire (1.5 week in). As part of my onboarding, I am ramping up on vibe coding with GitHub Copilot. The issue is I am unable to add or switch language models e.g. Anthropic to do test and learn. I did some investigations. Under my GitHub Sap profile, these language models are disabled. Yet my co-workers did not have such issues and was able to switch to approved models e.g. Claude Sonnet 3.5/3.7/4. I tried Github support and they told me it's a policy issue and I need to contact the orgs. Refer to screenshots. 

[Ask] Does anyone know how I can contact the following orgs to get them to enable these features?

  1. SAP-Copilot
  2. SAP-Copilot-cn

I am sorry if I don't know how to word my problem nicely. I am stuck and don't know how to resolve. Please help.

Kind regards,
Loh

entry.title: Re: Manual GL Account Assignment for Billing Transactions
entry.content:
Hello @mbanggo 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, It is not possible to alter the reconciliation account when creating a supplier invoice referencing a PO or through the Create Supplier Invoice app (F0859). The reconciliation account is always obtained from the supplier master record and cannot be manually overridden.

The only case where an alternative G/L can be chosen is in direct FI postings, Post Supplier Invoice-Manage Supplier Invoices for Accounts Payable Accountant F0859  ‚Äì FB60 equivalent. Since these are not subledger-managed postings.

Reference: SAP Help ‚Äì Supplier Invoice Processing (Public Cloud)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to do Odata Services from BEx Query
entry.content:
Very well explained, we are getting a precision error saying  that it is not supported, even though the BEx query measure precision is 17. the OData entity type property by default defines it as 42. How can we override this with the actual key measure property coming from BEx query.

Appreciate your help here

entry.title: Automatic addition of 1<>1 in queries when no data is returned in prompts (BO 4.3)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am using SAP BusinessObjects 4.3 Webi reports and observed the following behavior:

- My report contains multiple queries that rely on a Customer ID prompt.
- When I enter a Customer ID that has no corresponding data, in some of the queries the WHERE clause automatically gets "1<>1" appended.
- This does not happen in all queries, only in some.

I understand that this might be a mechanism to prevent unintended results, but I would like to clarify:

1. Is this behavior officially documented by SAP?
2. Is there a recommended approach to handle prompts so that "1<>1" is not automatically added?
3. Are there best practices for handling queries with potentially empty result sets in BO 4.3?

Attached are screenshots showing the SQL generated with and without data.

Thank you in advance for any guidance or insights!

entry.title: Re: SOAP API for inbound delivery updates
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Batch split creation is not available in the Inbound Delivery, Read, Update (A2X) API. While the API allows updating headers and items, it does not support batch split operations.

In Public Cloud, batch splits must be managed through Fiori delivery apps or by using an extension (BAdI/BTP) after the delivery is created.

Batch Management-SAP Help 

Inbound Delivery (A2X)  

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: ASSIGN PURCHASING ORGANIZATION TO COMPANY CODE
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

Yes, you can reverse the plant‚Äìpurchasing organisation assignment, but it affects info records, contracts, open POs, and sourcing. Existing documents with the old assignment stay valid, while new ones follow the new mapping.

Before moving to Production, test in Q/Test.

  • Create new POs and verify sourcing and pricing.
  • Validate contracts, scheduling agreements, and vendor purchasing organisation data.
  • Run MRP to confirm sourcing functions correctly.
  • Verify the financial institution's postings and approvals.

Assigning Plant to Purchasing Organisation-SAP Help 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Split Valuation in SAP MM
entry.content:
Prezados colegas,

Fa√ßo parte do tempo de implementa√ß√£o do SAP/4Hana desde janeiro de 2025 e atualmente o projeto est√° na terceira onda que dever√° integrar todo o grupo a n√≠vel Brasil com a mesma base do SAP.

Na primeira onda optamos por realizar uma avalia√ß√£o dividida para determinados tipos de materiais, a partir das instru√ß√µes da consultoria contratada, e na √©poca fomos avisados ‚Äã‚Äãque uma vez ativada essa fun√ß√£o seria irrevers√≠vel para o material.

No entanto, devido √† legisla√ß√£o tribut√°ria brasileira, temos uma lista de c√≥digos de origem de material. Em v√°rios casos, um mesmo c√≥digo de produto cadastrado pode variar entre as v√°rias origens, dependendo do neg√≥cio concretizado.

A partir dessa l√≥gica, a Requisi√ß√£o de Compra emitida pelas √°reas Requisitantes envolve as informa√ß√µes dos Dados Mestres de Materiais de maneira autom√°tica. No entanto, a confirma√ß√£o da origem do material ocorre somente na fase de Cota√ß√£o e Negocia√ß√£o pela equipe de Compras .

Os c√≥digos de origem do material v√£o de 0 a 9, e um mesmo produto pode variar entre v√°rios desses c√≥digos dependendo da origem do BP e da composi√ß√£o do produto.

A equipe de Compras recebe as requisi√ß√µes das √°reas e somente ap√≥s consultar o mercado definir qual fornecedor tem custos e, por fim, ap√≥s aprova√ß√£o das melhores condi√ß√µes definir o c√≥digo de origem do material para emitir o Pedido de Compra .

Sabemos que  ao solicitar uma avalia√ß√£o dividida no material, o campo origem do material fica travado/bloqueado para edi√ß√£o nas transa√ß√µes ME21N, ME22N, ME51N, ME52N onde a equipe de Compras utiliza para formalizar a compra de mercadorias atrav√©s de Pedidos de Compras e Contratos . Desta forma, tantos pedidos de compras emitidos pela ME21N ou alterados pela ME22N, como Contratos de Fornecimento WK/MK emitidos via ME51N ou alterados via ME52N n√£o possuem o campo de origem do material habilitado para conciliar a informa√ß√£o conforme neg√≥cio finalizado junto com a BP.

Com base nesse bloqueio, consultamos o SAP e verificamos que h√° uma Nota SAP que recomenda n√£o editar quando h√° split valuation Standard ativado. Al√©m disso, verificamos no QAS a possibilidade de reconfigurar esse campo (torn√°-lo edit√°vel) via SHD0, e chegamos √† conclus√£o de que n√£o permite reconfigurar justamente por esse Note SAP.

Queremos uma solu√ß√£o r√°pida para essa falha no processo de Aquisi√ß√£o, atrav√©s de uma melhoria nas transa√ß√µes supracitadas que se adequem √† legisla√ß√£o brasileira para atender n√£o somente ao nosso projeto, mas para  todos os clientes SAP no Brasil. Pois o impacto negativo ao neg√≥cio √© enorme e a melhoria traria flexibilidade aos usu√°rios de Compras e maior assertividade nos neg√≥cios junto √† BP, evitando retrabalhos nos dados mestres, altera√ß√µes constantes em Pedidos de Compras e Contratos, atrasos nas transa√ß√µes de estoques e concilia√ß√µes nos objetos de custos, al√©m de riscos de atrasos de pagamentos das compras realizadas.

Estamos √† disposi√ß√£o para testar em massa essa melhoria atrav√©s do SAP/4Hana.

Fico grato pela aten√ß√£o.
Rodrigo Vieira de Carvalho

entry.title: Re: Error en aplicaci√≥n Nota 3613078
entry.content:
Hola Comunidad

Algunos de ustedes aplicaron la opci√≥n 2 de la nota 3613078, en mi caso particular en periodo quincenal 19.2025 aplique 3 faltas como la constante CKINF esta en cero el descuento lo hace por el total de d√≠as y eel empleado es solvente para este descuento.

En periodo 20.2025 hace recalculo a periodo 19.2025 y en periodo 20.2025 regresa lo que desconto en 19 y calcula el descuento a 16 d√≠as lo cual es correcto.

Mi duda es por que regresa /381 que descont√≥ correctamente en periodo 19

el /381 tiene en vista V_T51P6 B 2 4 como lo sugiere la nota.

Espero y alguno de ustedes me pueda apoyar.

Saludos

entry.title: Deleting double postings after mapping data through Data Actions
entry.content:
@N1kh1l Hello all,

I load data through CSV file where Func Area and Plant = #. I have made this data action to map combinations to correct Func Area (I dont care about Plant) looking up budget data from last year. It maps correctly, however the old combinations stays there. I have tried saving the data before mapping on a variablemember and a if statement that deletes if input = temp version. However, there are sometimes a few new combinations that wasnt there last year in budget Version. I don't want to delete them. With this method, I delete them also unfortunately.

Do anyone have an idea, where I only delete the old combinations (that is still on func area = # ) that have been mapped? Or better, dont make double transactions.

@N1kh1l  ?

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/FUNC_AREA], [d/COST_CENTER], [d/PROFIT], [d/Plant], [d/GL_ACCOUNT]

//SCOPE
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/From_Date] TO [d/Version].[p/To_Date]
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = ("Amount_LC")

VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMP OF [d/Version] 
VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMPBUDGET OF [d/Version]

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/Plant]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/Plant] = "#"

//DATA WRITING
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Input", [d/FUNC_AREA] = "#")
* (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")) / RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")))

entry.title: Re: Add the custom field I added to the sales order to th...
entry.content:
Hello @dogukanpadel 

My Inbox and workflow apps don‚Äôt allow Adapt UI, so the message is expected. To display your custom field YY1_AvansMiktar, you need to

  • Publish the field in the right business context (done).
  • Extend the workflow context via Manage Workflow Scenarios or a Custom CDS View/Data Source Extension.
  • Adjust the workflow form template so the field appears in My Inbox.

You must extend the workflow data model and form template.

Let me know how it goes

My Inbox(F0862) 

With regards

Chuma
